articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Insurgents gained control after only a day of fighting, leaving President Bashar al-Assad's 24-year rule dangling by a thread as rebels marched on Damascus.
articles.title: Syria rebels celebrate in captured Homs, set sights on Damascus

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: The United States unveiled a $988 million aid package of new arms and equipment to Ukraine for its ongoing fight against Russia's invasion on Saturday.
articles.title: US readies $988 million aid package to Ukraine including rockets and drones

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli strikes in Gaza killed at least 34 Palestinians on Saturday, health officials in the enclave said, as Qatar voiced hope of fresh momentum in efforts to reach a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: At least 34 killed in Gaza as Qatar holds hope for ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas released a video claiming to show Israeli hostage Matan Zangauker in captivity on Saturday.
articles.title: Hamas releases hostage video claiming to show living hostage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's acceleration in its enrichment of uranium to close to bomb grade is "extremely serious", has no civilian justification and contradicts Tehran's assertions on wanting serious nuclear negotiations, a Western diplomatic source said on Saturday.
articles.title: Iran's nuclear leap 'extremely serious', Western source says

articles.author: Ingrid Melander, Ardee Napolitano
articles.description: Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens its doors on Saturday, five-and-a-half years after it was ravaged by a devastating fire that destroyed its spire and roof and brought the entire Gothic masterpiece within minutes of collapsing.
articles.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday, five years after fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will begin a multi-day visit to the Gulf on Sunday, his first trip to the region since taking office, seeking stronger economic and defence ties with the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: UK's Starmer to push for stronger ties with UAE, Saudi Arabia in first Gulf visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Sunday that China had nearly doubled the number of its warships operating around the island in the previous 24 hours, ahead of what security sources expect will be a new round of war games.
articles.title: Taiwan reports near doubling of Chinese warships nearby

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Bashar al-Assad used Russian and Iranian firepower to beat back rebel forces during years of civil war but never defeated them, leaving him vulnerable when his allies were distracted by wars elsewhere and his enemies went on the march.
articles.title: Iron-fisted Assad under threat as Syrian rebels draw closer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian rebels said on Sunday they have begun entering the capital Damascus without any sign of army deployments.
articles.title: Syrian rebels say they have begun entering the capital Damascus
